description:
Tech for Posterity. Challenges for the Future of AI Ethics and DEI
Speakers: Oyidiya Oji

Summary
For the first time, PyData Global is organizing "Tech for Posterity. Challenges for the Future of AI Ethics and DEI" and it will take place on 30th October. This workshop is for everyone who is interested in these amazing topics. We encourage everyone to join and learn a diverse number of top-notch experts on both fields.

Description
The workshop structure will be as follows:

16:00 - 16:10 Welcome (Oyidiya Oji)
16:10 - 16:30 AI Ethics and DEI Are a Leadership Responsibility (Tebogo R. Mazibuko)
16:30 - 16:50 Safe Spaces: Where Everyone Is Safe To Be Themselves (Marie Roker-Jone)
16:50 - 17:10 Q&A - How to Be an Ally?
17:10 - 17:30 How to build an AI Ethics Committee (Ana Chubinidze)
17:30 - 18:00 Panel: How to overcome Impostor Syndrome?
18:00 - 18:10 Break
18:10 - 18:30 DEI Hiring and AI Ethics (Hnin EiEi Tun)
18:30 - 18:50 The Importance of Safe Spaces in the Workplace (Kave Bulambo)
18:50 - 19:30 Panel: The Future of Work
19:30 - 19:35 Closing
19:35 - 20:00 Networking at gather.town with all participants9 different talks about AI Ethics and DEI.

Oyidiya Oji's Bio
Oyidiya is a former international athlete and a data scientist from Barcelona. She is passionate about data and her curiosity made her discover that tech products are not yet made for everyone. She loves giving awareness about this and other issues as well as empowering tech leaders and users to fight for change in the tech industry.
GitHub: https://github.com/oyidiyaoji/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/oyidiyaoji/
LinkedIn: https://twitter.com/oyidiyaoji/

PyData Global 2021
Website: https://pydata.org/global2021/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/pydata-global
Twitter: https://twitter.com/PyData

www.pydata.org

PyData is an educational program of NumFOCUS, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization in the United States. PyData provides a forum for the international community of users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. The global PyData network promotes discussion of best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization. PyData communities approach data science using many languages, including (but not limited to) Python, Julia, and R. 

PyData conferences aim to be accessible and community-driven, with novice to advanced level presentations. PyData tutorials and talks bring attendees the latest project features along with cutting-edge use cases.

title: Tech for Posterity Challenges for the Future of AI Ethics and DEI - Oyidiya Oji | PyData Global 2021
